Name: Box on Tall Legs with Decoration
Description: This elaborate rectangular box was found in the tomb of Tutankhamun. It contained four headrests and fragments of a decayed robe. It stands on four slim elegant legs. Below the bottom of the box is an ebony brace; between the space formed by this and the lower rails of the box is an alternating decoration of fretwork hieroglyphs consisting of the Ankh, "Was," and Neb signs. The lid is made of a rectangular ebony framework with a cross-rail dividing it into two panels.
